Label: 10x chromium ATAC-seq
synonyms: 10x chromium ATAC sequencing assay|10x chromium ATAC-seq assay
definition: An ATAC-seq assay that involves use of the 10x sequencing technology assay for transposase-accessible chromatin using sequencing (ATAC-seq).

Label: anterograde tracing assay
definition: An assay wherein axon projections are traced from their source (cell body or soma) to their point of termination (synapse).

Label: composite in situ imaging
definition: A fluorescence microscopy assay wherein fluorescence in situ hybridization is leveraged with multiplexed analysis that uses each channel to measure the composite (sum) abundances of multiple genes in each channel and decompresses and determines individual gene level.

Label: cre-dependent anterograde tracing assay
definition: A anterograde tracing assay that uses a Cre recombinase-dependent as a tracer.

Label: droplet-based single-cell RNA sequencing assay
definition: A sequencing assay that analyzes mRNA transcripts from droplets of individual cells. The droplets are compartmentalized via a microfluidic device. After the cells are compartmentalized, cells in droplets are lysed and the released mRNA hybridizes to the oligo(dT) tract of the primer beads. Then the droplets are pooled and broken to release the beads which are then isolated and reverse-transcribed with template switching. The resulting cDNA strands are PCR-amplified and the sequencing adapters are added. The barcoded mRNA samples are then sequenced.

Label: fluorescence in situ hybridization assay
definition: A sequencing assay that uses fluorescent probes that bind to parts of a nucleic acid sequence that have a high degree of sequence complementarity. Fluorescence microscopy can be used to find out where the fluorescent probes are bound on the chromosomes.

Label: fluorescence micro-optical sectioning tomography assay
definition: An imaging assay that uses micro-optical sectioning tomography technology combined with fluorescence molecular labeling of neuronal projections.

Label: light sheet fluorescence microscopy assay
definition: A fluorescence microscopy assay that uses a laser light-sheet to illuminate a region of a sample that has been treated to excite fluorescently.

Label: mosaicism with repeat frameshift genetic sparse labeling assay
definition: A neuron morphology assay that enables sparse and stochastic labeling of genetically-defined neurons. MORF-labeled neurons are digitally reconstructed using a program (G-Cut).

Label: mouselight
definition: A serial two photon tomography assay that produces images of mouse brains with sufficient detail to represent axons of individual neurons.

Label: multi-electrode extracellular electrophysiology assay
definition: An electrophysiology assay that employs many electrodes to record extracellular field potentials.

Label: multiplexed error-robust fluorescence in situ hybridization assay
definition: An imaging assay that measures the copy number and spatial distribution of hundreds to thousands of RNA species in single cells.

Label: neuron morphology assay
definition: A 3D structure determination assay that determines the morphology of a neuron.

Label: neuron morphology reconstruction assay
definition: A neuron morphology assay where the morphology or structure of a neuron is represented through through another medium. Often, this assay is a combination of different assays (sparse labeling, fluorescent labeling, fMOST).

Label: optical coherence tomography assay
definition: An imaging assay that has as an output label-free, cross-sectional imaging of biological tissue microstructure using tissue backscattering properties.

Label: patch clamp single-cell RNA sequencing assay
definition: A single-cell RNA sequencing assay wherein a patch clamp recording is taken from a neuron and then scRNA sequencing is performed on the cell soma.

Label: retrograde tracing assay
definition: An assay wherein a substance is taken up by an axon terminal and transported toward the soma to mark (or trace) some part of a cell.

Label: retrograde transsynaptic tracing assay
definition: A retrograde tracing assay that traces the neural connections from a synapse to a soma allowing the mapping of connections between neurons in a structure and a target in the brain.

Label: sci-ATAC-seq3
synonyms: 3-level sci-ATAC-seq|3-level single-cell combinatorial indexing ATAC sequencing assay
definition: An ATAC-seq assay that involves single-cell combinatorial indexing at three levels.

Label: sci-RNA-seq3
synonyms: 3-level sci-RNA-seq|3-level single-cell combinatorial indexing RNA sequencing assay
definition: A RNA sequencing assay that involves three levels of indexing.

Label: sequential fluorescence in situ hybridization assay
definition: A fluorescence in situ hybridization assay where transcripts are labeled with fluorescent probes in sequential rounds of hybridization to read out the temporal barcode for each transcript. The temporal barcodes can then be decoded to uniquely identify the RNA transcripts present in the sample. RNA can be identified directly in a variety of samples from extracted RNA to tissues.

Label: serial two-photon tomography
definition: A fluorescence microscopy that generates high-throughput flourescence imaging of mouse brains by integrating two-photon microscopy and tissue sectioning. Serial two-photon tomography generates high-resolution datasets.

Label: single-nucleus chromatin accessibility and mRNA expression sequencing assay
definition: A single-cell RNA sequencing assay that involves the isolation of single nuclei and open chromatin tagmentation in the isolated nuclei using a transposase. The tagmented nuclei are then encapsulated in a droplet including both an oligo-dT-containing barcoded bead and a splint oligonucleotide, which links the tagmented gDNA fragments to the bead, enabling the bead to capture both mRNAs and open chromatin fragments. After mRNAs and gDNA fragments are released from the bead by heating, RT and PCR amplification are performed to generate a library of cDNA and open chromatin gDNA fragments.

Label: switching mechanism at the 5' end of RNA template sequencing assay
definition: A single cell sequencing assay wherein the target cells are lysed, and the RNA is hybridized to an oligo(dT)-containing primer. The first strand of the cDNA is synthesized with the addition of a few untemplated C nucleotides. This poly(C) overhang is added exclusively to full-length transcripts. An oligonucleotide primer is hybridized to the poly(C) overhang and used to synthesize the second strand. Full-length cDNAs are PCR-amplified to obtain nanogram amounts of DNA. The PCR products are purified for sequencing.

Label: switching mechanism at the 5' end of RNA template sequencing assay 2
definition: A switching mechanism at the 5' end of RNA template sequencing assay that allows the generation of full-length cDNA and sequencing libraries by using standard reagents.

Label: switching mechanism at the 5' end of RNA template sequencing assay v4
definition: A switching mechanism at the 5' end of RNA template sequencing assay that is the fourth version of such an assay.

Label: tracing the relationship between input and output study design
definition: A study design in which complementary viruses are to be injected into brain regions to monosynaptically label inputs to a specific projection neuron population.

Label: volumetric imaging with synchronized on-the-fly oblique-scan and readout assay
definition: A light sheet microscopy assay that combines synchronized scanning illumination and oblique imaging over cleared, thick tissue sections in smooth motion that produces a 3D image of a brain.

Label: assay for transposase-accessible chromatin using sequencing
definition: An assay to capture the location of open chromatin, DNA-binding proteins, individual nucleosomes and chromatin compaction at nucleotide resolution by Tn5 transposase insertion.

Label: calcium imaging assay
synonyms: Ca imaging|Ca2+ imaging|Ca imaging assay|Ca2+ imaging assay
definition: An imaging assay that is designed to show the calcium (Ca2+) levels of a tissue or medium.

Label: confocal microscopy
definition: A microscopy technique used in optimal imaging that increases optical resolution and contrast of a micrograph by using point illumination and a spatial pinhole to eliminate out-of-focus light in specimens that are thicker than the focal plane. It enables the reconstruction of three-dimensional structures from the obtained images.

Label: DNA sequencing assay
definition: A sequencing assay which determines information on the sequence of a DNA molecule.

Label: electron microscopy imaging assay
definition: An imaging assay in which an electrons are used to probe the density, shape and composition of an input material which are detected in an electron microscope and utilized to produce an image of the material.

Label: RNA sequencing assay
definition: An assay that determines the sequence of an RNA molecule.

Label: histological assay
definition: An assay that uses visual examination of cells or tissue (or images of them) to make an assessment regarding a quality of the cells or tissue. This assay can include steps of staining, imaging, and judgement.

Label: in-situ hybridization assay
definition: An assay that localizes a specific DNA or RNA sequence within a portion or section of tissue using artificially induced nucleic hybridization.

Label: whole-cell patch clamp assay
definition: A patch-clamp assay where the electrode is left in place on the cell, as in cell-attached recordings, but the membrane patch has been perforated, providing access from the interior of the pipette to the intracellular space of the cell. Measurements made with this technique involve recording currents through multiple channels simultaneously, over the membrane of the entire cell.

Label: microarray assay
definition: An analyte assay where binding of the analyte to immobilized matrix is measured.

Label: SHARE-seq assay
definition: A RNA-seq assay that uses high-throughput ATAC and RNA expression with sequencing to measure chromatin accessibility and gene expression in the same single cell.

Label: slide-seq assay
definition: A RNA-seq assay for transferring RNA from tissue sections onto a surface covered in DNA-barcoded beads with known positions, allowing the locations of the RNA to be inferred by sequencing.

Label: magnetic resonance imaging assay
definition: An imaging assay in which nuclear magnetic resonance is used to produce information about the interior structure and composition of an input material entity.

Label: optical coherence tomography assay
definition: An imaging assay that has as an output label-free, cross-sectional imaging of biological tissue microstructure using tissue backscattering properties.
